description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8cpdd","text":"Nowadays, doing molecular biology frequently boils down to \"mixing small volumes of clear liquids.\" The volumes we're working with are very small indeed: down to one or two microliters (a microliter, abbreviated µl, is one one-thousandth of a milliliter.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qop2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b89ap","text":"To accurately transfer these small volumes from one container to another, we use tools called micropipettors. This protocol is intended to get you familiar with how to use a micropipettor. It is also an opportunity to practice computing dilutions, which is a skill you'll use over and over in this lab an others.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9mdk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9oj7p","text":"Adapted from Dilution and Pipetting Lesson Using Food Dyes, by Burnett et al (CourseSource)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":46}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A6239B900C2811EDA624DF86F7186954","url":"https://qubeshub.org/community/groups/coursesource/publications?id=2556\u0026tab_active=about\u0026v=1"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"1dqjh","text":"Pipetting tips:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9c1le","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6sqac","text":"DO NOT TWIST THE PIPETTOR BEYOND ITS MAXIMUM VOLUME. For example, do not try to set a P200 to 250 µl. It will break the pipettor, and repairs are expensive.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":53},{"style":"bold","offset":102,"length":54}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvgmq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgutr","text":"Do not re-use tips. Eject the tip after each transfer and use new one for the next transfer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2o0bn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qfm9","text":"Use the smallest pipettor that will transfer the entire volume at once. For example, if you need to transfer 250 µl, set a P-1000 to 250 µl. Do NOT use a P-200 to transfer 200 µl, then 50 µl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":72}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
image_attribution: James Burnette, Lisa Kanizay, Nikki Chester, Susan R Wessler, from "Dilution and Pipetting Lesson Using Food Dyes", https://qubeshub.org/community/groups/coursesource/publications?id=2556&tab_active=about&v=1
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"bcr5s","text":"Micropipettor tips: 1000 µl, 200 µl, and 10 µl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajlia","text":"10X stock food dye solutions: one tube each of red, blue, green and yellow","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"as71l","text":"Tap water (in a small beaker or flask)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f76gf","text":"An empty small beaker or flask","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8fc9","text":"Eight empty microcentrifuge tubes ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ais0d","text":"Eight empty 200 µl PCR tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"22uhr","text":"Adjusting the volume of the micropipettor correctly is the most important part of the process.  Refer to the image below for how to set each of the micropipettors.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gror","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85ckr","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aq314","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5jued","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6B923320087611ED90A12D213ECAC3DB","height":483,"id":273344,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c7fvd","text":"(I adapted this figure from somewhere but I cannot remember or find where. If this is yours, please contact me so I can attribute you properly!)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"pipettor practice.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ik8cbvh6p.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ik8abvh6p.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ik8bbvh6p.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ik79bvh6p.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1r5u5","text":"You may have a P-10 instead of a P-2 -- adjust it like you would a P-20.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6mvlc","text":"Grab the P-1000.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sgql","text":"Set it to transfer   of liquid. (DO NOT TRY TO MAKE IT READ 4-0-0 - YOU WILL BREAK THE MICROPIPETTOR. IF YOU HAVE QUESTIONS, ASK.) Double-check with an instructor or a TA to make sure you have it set correctly. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":99}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ee68","text":"Press the barrel of the micropipettor firmly into a P-1000 tip. (These are often in blue tip boxes.)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":84,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cu4o","text":"Press the plunger down to the first stop. (Do this out \"in the air\", not in the water.)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":30,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12g72","text":"Insert the tip into the beaker of water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmnah","text":"Smoothly release the plunger. (Don't just take your finger off and let it \"snap\" back up.) This will draw water into the tip.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3udc4","text":"Put the opening at the bottom of the tip against the side of the empty beaker.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5201b","text":"Press the plunger down all the way to the bottom of its travel. This will dispense the water into the beaker.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":23,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gma2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qcda","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m5fe","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bt6da","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gd4h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rbu8","text":" Using the tip ejector, eject the tip into the sharps container or biohazard bag.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7umb","text":"If you'd like, repeat this process several times to get a feel for it.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4b423","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ff2g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bu34v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"91l6i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmovl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"E84EF5600C2711EDA624DF86F7186954","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5ti8d","text":"Don't dispense the water into the middle of the air; always dispense onto the side of the receiving container. This is especially important for very small volumes.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3a362","text":"Don't re-use tips! Use a single tip for a single transfer, then eject it and use a fresh one.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7s81c","text":"Repeat step 2 using the P-200. Set it to . Use 200 µl tips. (These are often in green tip boxes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":80,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e5p3v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"175","error":false,"guid":"F1A455100C2711EDA624DF86F7186954","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1augu","text":"Repeat step 2 using the P-20. Set it to  . Again, use the 200 µl tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6pd79","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"12.5","error":false,"guid":"F5D184000C2711EDA624DF86F7186954","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"qetr","text":"Repeat step 2 using the P-2. (You may have a P-10 instead -- if so, you'll set it using the same instructions for the P-20.) Set it for  . Use the 10 µl tips (they're often in red tip boxes.)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":136,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dl7ma","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lv98","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gc3f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"257dv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.75","error":false,"guid":"0223D0000C2811EDA624DF86F7186954","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dfkrc","text":"Here, it is especially important that you dispense the water into the liquid that's already in the container (preferred) or onto the side of the container.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38rk0","text":"The food dye provided to you is at a 10X concentration. You will need to make four working stocks at 1X concentration. In the table below, you are given the final volume for a 1X solution of each dye. Use the formula cl * v1 = c2 * v2 to compute the amount of dye and the amount of water you'll need to mix for a 1X solution and fill out the table. Have an instructor or TA double-check your math.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":37,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":101,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":217,"length":17},{"style":"sub","offset":218,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":223,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":228,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":233,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9g27","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ivm4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27dd4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bpqrg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":[100,"165","168","124"],"data":[["Tube Label","Amount of 10X dye (µl)","Amount of water (µl)","Total volume (µl)"],["Red","","","500"],["Blue","","","1000"],["Green","","","750"],["Yellow","","","870"]],"guid":"2A4ED2E0087811ED90A12D213ECAC3DB","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Tube Label","Amount of 10X dye (µl)","Amount of water (µl)","Total volume (µl)"],["Red","","","500"],["Blue","","","1000"],["Green","","","750"],["Yellow","","","870"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6srpo","text":"Label 4 tubes: Red (R), Blue (B), Green (G) and Yellow (Y)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bre78","text":"Make 1X dilutions according to your calculations above in Table 1 by mixing the dye and water volumes you computed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1f255","text":"Add the volume of water to the first tube.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"foloc","text":"Add the dye to the first tube.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nlvl","text":"Snap the tube cap closed and flick or vortex briefly to mix.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2ic4","text":"Repeat with the rest of the tubes.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Make mixtures of the working stock solutions
Make mixtures of the working stock solutions

steps.section: Make mixtures of the working stock solutions
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"663l5","text":"Compare your results to the standards provided by the instructor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"74cr6","text":"Starting at step 6, repeat the entire protocol at 1/10th scale. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":31,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2v8q7","text":"For example, if the volume says 500 µl, use 50 µl instead. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gobv","text":"Use PCR tubes instead of microcentrifuge tubes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r15n","text":"Don't forget to compare your results to the standards provided by the instructor!","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Dilutions and Pipetting Practice
